qas.question: What can be paired with transmission lines to create phases that would support output?
What is the most common element used to create a single in phase signal?
What must be precise in order to create this signal at output?
What is a more complicated occurrence of the single in-phase producing antenna?

context: It is also possible to use multiple <a0_0>active elements<a0_0/> and combine them together with transmission lines to produce a similar system where the phases add up to reinforce the output. The antenna array and very similar reflective array antenna consist of multiple elements, often <a1_0>half-wave dipoles<a1_0/>, spaced out on a plane and wired together with transmission lines with specific <a2_0>phase lengths<a2_0/> to produce a single in-phase signal at the output. The <a3_0>log-periodic<a3_0/> antenna is a more complex design that uses multiple in-line elements similar in appearance to the Yagi-Uda but using transmission lines between the elements to produce the output.
